channel.title: If Jagex ate shit
channel.description: Do you think RuneScape would die if JaGeX somehow they fell, or do you think they would sell RuneScape to another game company. If so, what company do you think would buy RuneScape... Or would RuneScape be whoever has the best Private Server..

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @Chronikk_HD Chronikk_HD
item.description:
@Chronikk_HD wrote:

TBH idek what to think of that question. If they did decide to close doors nobody is guaranteed their membership back… which would suck ass. And I don’t think any other company would be good with Runescape cause its been with JAgex for so long

Read full topic

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

rofl I used to play ACe of Spades for free when like 1000 ppl played

Read full topic

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:34, topic:535248”][quote author=Austin-happyguy link=topic=654049.msg4388164#msg4388164 date=1386471922]

This is where they went wrong… Andrew Gower hired a CEO that never played runescape before.

A CEO who knew nothing about video games.

And the only reason Jagex is still alive is because of RuneScape, look at all their failed projects (Funorb & StellarDawn)

You forgot to mention their failed project, Ace of Spades. It was fun in the beginning but they did what they do best and messed it up…
[/quote]
They just published it they didn’t make it[/quote]This. After Jagex bought the game, they had Blitz Games Studios develop it until Blitz went under in September. Now, Jagex actually develops it in-house. Before Jagex took over the development Blitz didn’t really care what was happening to the game, but Jagex now is actually giving the players what they want.

Read full topic

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:30, topic:535248”][quote author=Kozs link=topic=654049.msg4381938#msg4381938 date=1383851279]

If this would happen, rsps community would rise and Jagex wouldn’t shutdown rsps anymore:p… Good times… Bring it down!

uh no they wouldnt

as the rsps community grows older they stop being involved with servers. If runescape shuts down there will be no new players to discover private servers

But all current players will search for new games and I’m sure lots of them will find toplists and moparscape.
and when there isn’t Jagex to stop rsps, there would be soon rsps advertisements instead of runescape’s.

RSPS are not multi million companys. Jagex is.
[/quote]they were not making millions months after released. they took time to advertise their product. soul split already makes like 200-300k a month. that’s over 2 million a year.[/quote]

Soulsplit probably makes 10,00 a month. Soulsplit is not THAT big of a server 2000 people is not that many tbh. For a RSPS it is… but ya know

Read full topic

Jagex stops offering the Jagex Product or you decide to cancel your subscription or account.

http://www.jagex.com/g=runescape/terms/terms.ws[/quote]

and? they’d have an easier time canceling the free memberships as they would paid ones.

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:14, topic:535248”]they do not promise they will provide a month of service. the agreement which you reach when paying is that you will pay the price for 30 or 90 days etc of premium content available. if you lose Internet connection or something happens and you don’t log in during that month, you are not reimbursed.

they do not promise you will get the content available at all times, but at least for what you paid for.

what I was getting at, they could easily cancel all renewing payments, so they will no longer renew the next month. then cancel subscriptions, so nobody can re purchase the product. the they allow the players to play until a said date (probably until the last player who bulk purchased memberships runs out) or perhaps their closing date.

whether or not you paid for content that would last until after the closing day, the amount of reimbursement required would be low. not many people buy membership months or years at a time. most people auto renew with debit cards.[/quote]
You forget that Jagex has handed out unlimited days memberships to players who have found serious bugs and lended a hand to jagex.

Read full topic

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @gunz4life gunz4life
item.description:
@gunz4life wrote:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:13, topic:535248”][quote author=Vain_ link=topic=654049.msg4381443#msg4381443 date=1383688738]

[quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654049.msg4381362#msg4381362 date=1383668183]

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=654049.msg4381360#msg4381360 date=1383668028]
^ they’re able to terminate your membership whenever they want. if they close, they don’t have to refund or allow people to finish.
[/quote]If you violate their terms ( bot etc) yes they can terminate it with no problems. If they shut down though that’s on them. I would be in the right to do a charge back.
[/quote]their terms do not promise their service will always be available. surely they would allow some type of notice that membership is cancelled and stop allowing people to purchase or renew and allow everyone to run out
[/quote]Their terms don’t have to - you are paying for a month’s service of membership so unless it is stated in the terms that you won’t get a month (such as due to bans) then they have to give you a month. If not, they haven’t given you the service/product that you bought and are breaking the law (and that would be a large damages payout given the amount of members)[/quote]

15. [b]Refund policy[/b] We are happy to review requests for refunds on a case by case basis. [b]However, refunds are not always possible to give for many reasons.[/b]

Unless required by law, we will not refund any amounts paid in relation to subscriptions, macro-game activities, RuneScape Bonds, virtual items or virtual currency when:

You have been the victim of in-game scamming, as there are many warnings about avoiding this on the Jagex Products (however, we will do everything we reasonably can to assist you to recover your accounts).

You have been banned from a Jagex Product for violating these terms and conditions, any Rules of a Jagex Product or the user content policy.

Jagex stops offering the Jagex Product or you decide to cancel your subscription or account.

If, after reading the above, you wish to request that we consider a refund, then please contact Billing Support for assistance, providing as much information as possible. Please note, refunds are given at the discretion of Jagex. If you are from the EU please also see “Right to cancel under Distance Selling Regulations” above.

http://www.jagex.com/g=runescape/terms/terms.ws

Read full topic

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @Kozs Kozs
item.description:
@Kozs wrote:

Jagex is an LTD (LLC) Limited Liability Company, if they did go under and you just bought membership and wanted your money back, where are you going to get it from?

Read full topic

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @Vain1 Vain_
item.description:
@Vain1 wrote:

they do not promise they will provide a month of service. the agreement which you reach when paying is that you will pay the price for 30 or 90 days etc of premium content available. if you lose Internet connection or something happens and you don’t log in during that month, you are not reimbursed.

they do not promise you will get the content available at all times, but at least for what you paid for.

what I was getting at, they could easily cancel all renewing payments, so they will no longer renew the next month. then cancel subscriptions, so nobody can re purchase the product. the they allow the players to play until a said date (probably until the last player who bulk purchased memberships runs out) or perhaps their closing date.

whether or not you paid for content that would last until after the closing day, the amount of reimbursement required would be low. not many people buy membership months or years at a time. most people auto renew with debit cards.

Read full topic

item.title: If Jagex ate shit
item.dc:creator: @Ambokile Ambokile
item.description:
@Ambokile wrote:

[quote=“Vain_, post:11, topic:535248”][quote author=Loveandpower link=topic=654049.msg4381362#msg4381362 date=1383668183]

[quote author=Vain_ link=topic=654049.msg4381360#msg4381360 date=1383668028]
^ they’re able to terminate your membership whenever they want. if they close, they don’t have to refund or allow people to finish.
[/quote]If you violate their terms ( bot etc) yes they can terminate it with no problems. If they shut down though that’s on them. I would be in the right to do a charge back.
[/quote]their terms do not promise their service will always be available. surely they would allow some type of notice that membership is cancelled and stop allowing people to purchase or renew and allow everyone to run out[/quote]Their terms don’t have to - you are paying for a month’s service of membership so unless it is stated in the terms that you won’t get a month (such as due to bans) then they have to give you a month. If not, they haven’t given you the service/product that you bought and are breaking the law (and that would be a large damages payout given the amount of members)

Read full topic
